page.title: 13NEW HOUGHTON -HOUGHTON
page.content: The name New Houghton refers to houses built in 1729 outside the Park Gates when Houghton Hall was built,and the old village near the church was removed.As listed buildings the exteriors of the houses must remain unaltered but modernisation inside has reduced the original dwellings to 26.There are also 2 farms and 2 lodges.Until 1945 all of these dwellings were occupied by estate workers or pensioners. Today only one third are needed by the estate , the rest are let or unoccupied.They cannot be sold. The population of New Houghton and Houghton Hall is 65. The School, Post Office, Chapel and the Social Club have all gone and the W.I. now meets in Rudham. There is still a Bowls Club with licensed bar within the park.
